reviewText: I recently arrended a Michael Buble show with my fiance and was amazed at his grasp of  his medium so it was a no brainer ro buy this DVD to carch up on what I had missed. Sadly, the viewing experience was not as good as I hoped it would be.The film focuses on the days leading up to Buble's first Madison Square Gaeden show. It features interviews with Buble and his band and film clips of highlights of the concert. Unfortunately ay a mere 68 minutes it does not feature the entire show. The film has its moments:a discussion of starting ar the famed Blue Note six years previously, the interaction og Buble and his musical director but the moments have a tendency to feel staged.The BluRay disc features the main program and two bunus songs. This one would work best as a bonus feature on a complete concert film. It is for true fans or those who just want to check out a small snippet of the performer's work.
Title: N/A

reviewText: But when I play it on my blu ray surround sound type machinery..it does not play in PCM Surround so as soon as I noticed that.. I stopped the disc.  Tried other blu rays and they worked fine...trying to return it for this reason may be a bear since I didn't get it on Amazon.  Learned my lesson.
summary: I'm sure it's a good concert

reviewText: Arrived in great condition and on time.  Michael is a singer who can sing anything and make it his own.  I just love his voice.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This s a great DVD to get to know Michael...the man...the employer...his climb to fame through his own words, NOT a concert at Madison Square Garden! A song here, a song there all interrupted by interviews, playing ping pong, horsing around with his crew, etc. I know that I could have read more about this DVD before I  bought it, but when a DVD is called "Michael B. meets Madison Square Garden", well, I expected Michael singing at Madison SG, not just talking about it. Good documentary, very informative but unfortunately I can't watch it more than once.
Title: N/A
